Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2011 02:33PM kimdy wrote: LeesaAnn, So glad you started this. I think you will be about 1-11/2 weeks ahead of me. I get my first of 6 treatments of T/C of Friday. Having port placed tomorrow..... Anxious and not sleeping well. Will look forward to walking this path with someone else. Thanks,
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan - December 2011 LeesaAnn AnnieLane

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2011 05:07AM kimdy wrote: Thanks for all the well wishes. My first treatment was on Friday...and I've really felt fine. Some bloating and some gas....but so much better than I ever anticipated. I have a seroma that is filling back up that I will get drained next week, but all in all so far so good. Anticipating the third day to pass and hoping it comes and goes without the flu-like symptoms I've read about. I did take anti nausea meds day of treatment and day after prophylactically. And hoping they've done the job...thinking many many prayers have done the job:) Sleep evades me tonight though.....last night the nurse practioner had instructed me to take an ativan with my anti nausea med at bedtime to counteract the iv steroid I got with treatment. I slept better than I've slept in a month!:) But don't want to get to where I have to have it to sleep....so tonight went to bed tired slept two hours and then can't sleep.....but no big complaints. Just so grateful to be symptom free at this point:) CKK - do you know when you will start your chemo....praying for peace as you wait. LeesaAnn - how's the fever. Does heat intensify the chemo effect just on your hair or should hot bathes be avoided. And if it effects my hair...the closer I get to the time they think it will fall out should I not use blow dryer etc. so much to learn:) Anniebell - I am beginning day 3 (finished 1st treatment on Friday at 1pm) I too am feeling for the most part 100%. Keep wondering if I walking around on borrowed time - if it will hit any moment or if this could be the way it will be. Will be interested to see, I know they tell me some of the side effects are cumulative so they could be worse as time goes on. Grateful so far. Wave - the whole wig thing is somewhat discouraging to me...but I know I will want one..Cut my hair short for the first time on Thursday before chemo on Friday. Have never worn short hair. Picked out a wig that is longer more like my hair was....Just feels funny. Hope I don't look like a TV evangelist wife in it:) Just kidding... Hope you ladies have a GREAT day! So grateful to be able to walk this difficult path with you! Hugs, Kim
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan - December 2011 LeesaAnn AnnieLane

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2011 08:22PM kimdy wrote: LeesaAnn - so sorry about the added stress with Daisy. Wish there was something we could say or do to make it better Anniebell how many post first treatment are you today/when you shaved your head? I went to the "Look Better, Feel Better class today" I am very anxious about the hair loss and whether I will feel the need to shave my head...in my mind I have not planned for my husband to see me bald...so would need someone else to shave it. Have picked out a wig, it came in today. Not sure if it is the right one. My college age daughter will be in this weekend so I thought I'd see what she thinks. Cut my hair shorter than ever and now my husband likes that, so trying to decide if I should go with a short or a longer wig. Since I will be without hair....I don't really have a preference. I have been achey today head, back, legs and some taste issues......but really nothing to complain about....wondering if I can expect all treatments to be this uneventful. Take Care Ladies
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan - December 2011 LeesaAnn AnnieLane

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2011 09:32PM kimdy wrote: Good morning ladies! Today is the day for my first cytoxin/taxotere treatment. And sleep just won't come tonight! Got my port Wednesday, haircut yesterday (never in my life have I worn my hair short, but it's not to bad-couldnt bring myself to go real short. It is between my chin and shoulders). Also picked our a wig yearsterday it should be in next week in the right color. Curious as we go if I or any of you will feel the need to shave our heads. Think I'm most anxious about the hair loss and the potential for vertigo,nausea/vomiting. Anyone else starting today? So grateful for the posts and input from those of you already on this road. Hugs, Kim

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2011 08:16PM kimdy wrote: bailey bump - WELCOME! my second of six treatments will be the 29th as well. Tax/Cyt as well...no neulasta as yet. Although my neutrophils were at .7 on day 7. So am interested to see what my oncologist says on the visit prior to treatment on 29th. Hoping my neutrophils have rebounded and I can get by without the neulasta. Still have hair, but they say it will start falling out around Christmas day...I got two wigs today. Robin - anxious to hear how your day was. Congratulations@ Two down:) Josie - i didn't have a prescription for Emed....I too think because insurance does not like to cover it. I took my zofran (generic) prophylactically and was so thankful to not have any trouble with nausea. No weight gain or loss as yet....was concerned about the weight gain due to steroids, but none as yet. Bought two wigs today....think it might be a cold time of year to just do hats.....but I'm not a big hat person. Heather - sorry your hair started to shed today....I'm hoping to be one of those that it goes all at once....as I'm petrified of shaving my head:( Let us kow if you make it to Wednesday and how that goes. lees - hope all goes well for you tomorrow:) ? to you all. Think I can get by without the neulasta shots? Those of you that are taking them. Are you taking Claritan the day before and the day of? And are you taking any pain relievers along with the Claritan. THANKS & Merry Christmas to all of you, Praying for an incredibly blessed holiday for each of you!

Posts.Content: Dec 26, 2011 01:32PM kimdy wrote: Merry Christmas to you all!! Christmas made me a little more emotional than usual this year. We are now with our kids at my parents and my hair has started to come out by handfuls. Hoping to keep it wearable until Tues-Wed but not sure if it will last. Any body wearing their wig yet? My scalp stings and hurts some nothing unbearable just sore and irritating Brought my wig justbin case. Lots of family tied it on tonight and we took pics Silly but trying to keep it light and try not to get to emotional about my hair going Praying for you guys. My second treatment will be 12/29

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2011 11:16PM kimdy wrote: Lab work yesterday showed neutrophulis at .7. And yesterday was day 7 in the treatment cycle. I was told dau 10-14 would be the lowest. Hoping I just went low early and won't be going lower:( But guess I will not be getting that last bit of shopping done or attending church - avoiding crowds Heather - how are you doing out of the hospital yet? I'm at .7. But no temp. Trying to avoid all germs that I can:). Will be praying your level come up quickly! Robin - so is Monday your second treatment? So are you in the lead for this group? My second treatment is 12/29. Praying for good results and little SE for your next round Ckk thanks for the food tips:) Shirley & Josie. Welcome BJMRN - how did today go? My first tx was 12/9. I too thought my oncologist wasn't telling me the truth when he said I wouldn't get sick:). I have not had any nausea and vomiting (took my zofran 48 hours prophylactically afterwards). Was a little achey day 3-4, had a couple of strange rashes and now low neutrophils. But truthfully feel so lucky up to this point. Let us know how you are doing. Rachel & Lisa. How are you guys doing? when are your next treatments? Lees still no fever.? Hoping each day is brighter for you Hope each of you feels better as Christmas approaches. Guess I will be hibernating her at home to try to avoid illness until Christmas eve Hugs to all
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan - December 2011 LeesaAnn AnnieLane

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2012 01:49PM kimdy wrote: Hey To Everyone!! Havn't been on in awhile. Had both my college kiddos home along with the other 5 for awhile over the holidays!!! LOVED IT!!! Had treatment #2 on 12/29 & #3 to be next Thursday! ? Are most of you having 4 treatments? My oncologist indicated at the start that I would have 6 treatments (if I tolerated 4 well I would have 2 more?) . So terrible SE as yet....No N/V thank the Lord just some ACHEY days, tiredness and just not feeling right....but nothing major to complain about. Have been doing some research on reconstruction as I think that will be the next major step for me as well as hormone therapy I guess once chemo is complete. Prayers and Hugs to you all:)
